About LegalZoom We're here to make legal help accessible to all. LegalZoom transformed the legal industry with the launch of our online services and groundbreaking technology in 2001. Since then, millions of customers have counted on us to officially start and run businesses, protect brands and intellectual property, and look after loved ones through wills and trusts. As the industry leader for over 20 years, innovation remains at the center of all we do. We're creative thinkers and problem solvers with a passion for building legal and tax products that make a positive impact on the world, and we're always looking for exceptional people to push us further. With us, you'll do work that's as rewarding as it is challenging with a team where every voice matters and diversity, equality, and inclusion are truly embraced. Together, we'll continue to democratize the law and make a real difference in the lives of millions. Overview Fulfillment is an essential part of how LegalZoom serves its customers. While much of our platform is highly automated, sometimes the complexity of providing services across every state and thousands of counties requires human intervention. In some cases, the difference between whether a customer successfully files for the formation of their new business or gets their estate plans in place is the work performed by our fulfillment team. As a data scientist working with our fulfillment team, you will help us get better visibility into what happens between the time a customer places an order and they get the products and services that they need from LegalZoom. By better tracking and understanding what happens in fulfillment, we can make it faster and easier for customers to do business with us, drive increased automation of our products and services, and have a positive impact on LegalZoom’s bottom line. While you will initially focus on metrics and strategic recommendations, over time this role has the potential to play a key role in how we automate more of the work done in fulfillment. You will Perform descriptive and predictive analyses to form hypotheses about how we can grow the business by delivering products and services faster, reducing the need for customers to contact us, and increasing our level of automation Establish and lead work in delivering our analytical roadmap for Fulfillment Influence LegalZoom leadership to pursue our hypotheses so that we better serve customers and grow our business Identify, role model, and evangelize data science best practices so that others become better practitioners as well Design and run experiments to test our hypotheses, including the definition of metrics that will enable us to understand customer behavior, product performance, and operational efficiency Interpret experiment results and use them to drive strategic and tactical recommendations for how to better serve our customers Provide insights at scale through building pipelines and dashboards that share the metrics you’ve created to provide us a more complete view of our products and services Work closely with business leaders to help them better understand how to use data as well as form their own hypotheses so we can move faster You have Intellectually Curious  – You know that stones are put there to be turned over and are always trying to look at things in a different way. You can’t stop asking “why” until you get to the truth. Sees the Big Picture but Sweats the Details  – You never lose sight of why the work you're doing matters. At the same time, you know that the devil is in the details. When working with a new set of data for the first time, you trust but verify that data are correct and make sense. But above all, you always return to the original question and make sure you’re making progress in answering it. Speaks Up  - Being right a lot is important but only if it leads to others taking action. You speak up - especially when it seems controversial to do so - because you know that we’re all trying to do the right thing and want the best ideas to win. Technically Sound  – Your code is easy to read and is correct. You know SQL really well and can probably write some Python or R. You can use visualization tools such as Tableau or Superset to produce straightforward visualizations that people can understand. Your colleagues like working with the things you’ve built because they’re thoughtfully designed and well-constructed. Analytically Sound  – Your use of data and analytical techniques is sound. You understand the statistical underpinnings of experimentation and can design robust experiments. You define metrics that capture relevant customer behaviors in a way that doesn’t mislead. The models you build get the most predictive power out of the data because you understand how the techniques you’re using work and know how to transform data so that those techniques are most effective. Sometimes you break the rules but you know the rules and have a principled reason for why you are doing so. Good Learner  - There is far more out there to know than any one of us can know but if given a little time you can pick up whatever it is you need to know to do the job. You efficiently seek answers for yourself but also know when to ask for help. Intentional  – You know what your priorities are and why they are your priorities. When asked to help with something, you seek to understand why it is important and consider whether it makes sense to engage before saying yes. Relevant Experience  – You've done something like this before. Whether it be a previous role in data science and analytics or something where you had to demonstrate the above qualities, at the staff level we need you to have some prior experience. In some cases, this can come from your academic background which is probably something STEM or with a quantitative bent. In this role we also covet people who have experience with fulfillment, operations research, industrial engineering, and similar disciplines.  Join us in making a difference as we build our future and help ensure access to professional legal advice to all! LegalZoom is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. LegalZoom prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Company:  Oak Street Health Title:  Data Scientist   Location:  Remote Oak Street Health is a network of value-based neighborhood primary care centers throughout the Midwest. Oak Street operates an innovative model that drives patient engagement, improves health outcomes, and manages medical costs for the older adult population. In this virtuous cycle: every dollar saved is another dollar we can reinvest to improve patient care. Our model supports our social mission of improving the health and happiness of our patients and the community. Role Description At Oak Street, Population Health drives both our clinical and economic model and is focused on delivering high-quality, cost-effective care. Members of this small and innovative team leverage Oak Street’s rapidly expanding data warehouse to develop and optimize interventions in collaboration with clinicians and subject matter experts. This role will advance the organization’s data science capabilities by building new predictive models using machine learning techniques, exploring advanced data science capabilities such as NLP, and supporting the integration and deployment of data science tools across the organization. The ideal candidate will have strong data science and machine learning skills, be an effective communicator and be committed to Oak Street Health’s mission to rebuild healthcare as it should be. Responsibilities Leverage Oak Street’s best-in-class data warehouse to build new predictive models focused on improving the care model and patient outcomes Achieve best in class model accuracy through a collaborative approach to feature engineering Co-create predictive analytic tools with clinical and business owners and support integration and deployment across organization Promote innovation by exploring and testing advanced data science techniques Evaluate program efficacy for various teams Continue rapid iteration cycle - test, learn, deploy - for new data science products Co-create and support processes to ensure data science initiatives are reliable and transparent across organization Other duties as assigned What we’re looking for We’re looking for motivated, experienced “position” with: 3+ years working with data in a healthcare or life sciences field Excellent command of data science libraries in R, Python, or Julia Experience with SQL-based relational databases Understanding of the use and misuse of statistics for causal inference Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Outstanding attention to detail An ability to independently pursue and implement solutions to complex problems Interest in innovation US work authorization Someone who embodies being “Oaky” Excellent oral and written communication skills Why Oak Street? Oak Street Health offers our coworkers advantages that can’t be found in other clinical workplaces, including: The opportunity to be part of a hyper-growth company, focused on changing the future of healthcare. Paid vacation/sick time, retirement options, as well as health, vision and dental benefits HQ (the “Treehouse”) is located in the heart of Fulton Market- with a beautiful loft work environment High levels of responsibility and rapid advancement Supportive and fun culture Opportunity to be at the forefront of a revolution in healthcare Why does Oak Street Health offer all of these benefits? Because we know what it takes to deliver the highest level of care, and our team deserves the best resources to succeed and enjoy their work. In return, we expect the best out of our co-workers. Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming an entire industry through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency holds companies accountable to strive to become better employers.  Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH. The Role  We are looking for a strong hands-on, technical senior manager to lead our Mobile Application Engineering team. You will be responsible for the popular, award-winning Glassdoor iOS and Android apps. Our mobile apps are part of the key strategy in Glassdoor's mission to help users find the jobs and companies they love. You will and the team will own all aspects of our native apps feature set and delivery.  Compensation:   $176,000.00 - $220,000.00  At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.  At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:   Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)  Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)  Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller  cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)   You can learn more about our compensation philosophy  here  and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs  here .  Your Responsibilities  You will lead a team of 6 engineers for both the iOS and Android applications. You will partner closely with product and design to define and plan successful delivery of all our mobile initiatives. You will enjoy being a hands-on technical leader with past experience building native apps and back-end services (ideally in Java). You will spend a fair amount of your time in the code partnering with the team on architecture level design decisions, dealing with the unexpected and working cross-team to coordinate on new product features. As a manager, your goals are serving your team to work at optimal levels by providing individual mentorship and feedback, a focus on continuous productivity improvement, and building a culture of transparency, involvement and results.  To be successful:   Partner with Product and other key business teams to prioritize work and craft amazing products and features.  Manage the tactical strategy and planning to achieve frequent work and quarterly objectives.  Hands-on mobile and server-side development. Your experience may be either Android or iOS. Server-side Java is required as often times creating or troubleshooting services is required.  Exhibits passion that elevates and inspires when leading the team including hiring, managing performance and developing skill set of direct reports  The ability to think logically and understand situations or problems by organizing or synthesizing information in a systematic way. It includes enthusiastically anticipating and identifying problems before they emerge, looking beyond symptoms to identify root causes, and developing alternative solutions.  Be part of the Glassdoor engineering leadership team by supporting and initiating continual improvement to our overall system architecture, process and tools.   Your Qualifications:   6+ years of software development experience building complex, popular mobile applications (you still love rolling up your sleeves and coding alongside your team).  3+ years of shown success leading, managing and hiring a team of hardworking engineers.  Shown success project managing technical work in an agile environment  Proficient with server-side Java technologies and hands-on development of services used in mobile transactions.  Experience with automated testing frameworks used for Mobile applications.  Experience partnering with various business units.  Confident, professional, and effective communicator (both verbally and in written form) that can work with all levels and departments in an organization and get his/her point across in a concise, articulate, and congenial way.  Bachelor's Degree in computer science highly preferred  Strong desire to add to our culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.   Why Glassdoor?   100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.  Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).  401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.  Generous paid holidays and open paid time off.  Our Values  Transparency:  We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback survey responses are shared publicly.  Innovation:  We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!  Good People:  We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.  GRIT:  We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.  Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:  We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. Our mission is to bring community and belonging to everyone in the world. Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. With more than 50 million people visiting 100,000+ communities daily, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. From pets to parenting, skincare to stocks, there's a community for everybody on Reddit. For more information, visit redditinc.com. We are looking for a Data Science Manager to lead the User Growth analytics team. You will partner closely with cross functional team leaders such as Product, Engineering, Design, UXR and other leaders in utilizing data to drive decision making. In addition to strong analytical skills, you will have a keen business acumen and the big picture thinking that can guide our User Growth strategy in a data driven manner.  Reddit is continuing to grow our teams with the best talent. We're  completely remote friendly  and will continue to be after the pandemic.  How You'll Have Impact:  The Growth team oversees onboarding efforts for new users, push notifications and emails for new and existing users, as well as top of funnel efforts such as SEO. You will manage a team of high-performing, highly motivated data scientists to unlock user growth for the company.  As a data science leader, you'll be a key player in ensuring we make the right product decisions based on data insights and help define the culture that is driven through metrics and KPIs. Your work will not only impact millions of users and thousands of advertisers but also act as a data foundation for our rapidly growing business.  What You'll Learn:   You will closely partner with our Product and Engineering teams to drive user growth for the company. Your team will play a key role in developing user product strategy and experiments. You'll partner with senior stakeholders to share data insights with the company.  In addition, your team will work side by side with a world-class organization of Engineering, Machine Learning, Search, Data Science, Data Warehouse, and Analytics practitioners who work together to create a variety of capabilities for Reddit to be more successful in its decision-making and product creation. In this process, you will be exposed to a variety of new techniques in experimentation, statistical frameworks, machine learning, deep learning, and causal inference.   What You'll Do :   Own the vision and roadmap for the Growth Data Science team to focus on high impact levers that inform product decision making  Build and mentor a team of highly motivated, high-performing data scientists and deliver business outcomes  Partner closely with Product and Engineering directors on org processes, learnings, and opportunities to establish a data-driven product lifecycle culture  Lead the team in conducting exploratory analysis for millions of users to understand their lifecycle, retention patterns and how we can serve them better  Lead the team in conducting product/feature analyses, opportunity sizing, experimentation (A/B testing) and build dashboards/visualizations to assess product health.  Collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders, including Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, UX Researchers, Data Engineers and Data Warehouse Engineers to lead projects related to organizing and analyzing data.  Be an integral part of the Data Org, leveraging and contributing to the vibrant knowledge base, shared across a community of world-class data experts.   Who You Might Be:   6+ years of experience in data analytics or related quantitative role  2+ years of experience in the tech growth space  2+ years of experience managing a team of 5 or more Data Scientists.  Demonstrated ability to influence and guide product strategy with data  Demonstrated ability to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way  Desire to mentor other data scientists and share best practices to elevate the data science practice at Reddit  Strong ability to communicate and discuss complex topics with technical & non-technical audiences  Proficiency with relational database (e.g., SQL) and statistical analysis/programming languages (e.g., R / Python)  Proficiency with dashboarding tools (e.g. Mode Analytics, Tableau, Looker)  Good understanding of Machine Learning techniques and platforms.  Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at  ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com .

This role will also actively participate in and lead troubleshooting and root cause analysis activities for on-market support. Design and conduct experiments in the laboratory and analyze scientific data in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices Lead troubleshooting and root cause analysis activities Participate in on-market product investigations through non-conformance investigations and CAPA processes Develop codes to execute custom scripts or protocols to extract information from instrument logs Prepare adequate reports and presentations to inform key stakeholders of findings and observations Work in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams including QC, engineers, software, and life science scientists. (High proficiency) Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint programs. (High proficiency) Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to work both in a team-oriented environment and independently (High proficiency) Excellent written and verbal communication skills (High proficiency) Strong organizational and problem-solving skills (High proficiency) Proven time management and prioritization skills (High proficiency) Data analysis and technical writing aptitude (High proficiency) Experience in common high level programming language such as Python recommended (Medium proficiency) Experience working in BSL2 environment preferred (Medium proficiency) Standard Physical Demands Must work onsite at Luminex office - Frequently Possible exposure to biological or chemical hazard, and/or working with lasers - Occasionally Work situations include dealing with people; working alone; making judgments and decisions - Frequently Travel Requirements 10% Domestic travel may be required Luminex Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. The Global Analytics Advisor (Data Science) is responsible for the design, implementation and ongoing management of business Analytics & Data Practices within Duracell. This position is responsible for leading end to end BI and Analytics solutions within Duracell with a focus on exploring predictive and other advanced analytics initiatives. The individual in this position is a key partner of the Regional representative, Business Analyst, and Functional Lead, translating business requirements into use cases and analytics solutions that align with the product strategy. This role reports to the Global Analytics Advisory and Enablement Leader. As the Global Analytics Analyst/Advisor, some of your essential duties and responsibilities may include: Develop and maintain key partnerships at executive and operational levels. Directly provide subject matter expertise, advisory services, and development as needed. Drive the predictive and advanced analytics capabilities of Duracell. Deliver value-add solutions at the speed of business. Educate and influence IT and business executives on how to best leverage analytics to maximize business benefits. Serve as the subject matter expert for a particular functional product and helps advise the delivery team. Provide thought leadership and innovative approach to solutions delivery; guide teams on emerging technology trends in data and analytics. Understand the current and future state of business requirements and tool capabilities. Own design, development, and support for a specific analytics function on which may be delivered via several solutions (dashboards, reports, etc.). Work with the Regional Lead to obtain user acceptance on the overall solution Manage the product backlog for a specific function. Define mutually agreed to metrics for success that are focused on the customer and the value generated. Interface with the Enterprise Business Intelligence team to ensure standards are followed and new core capabilities are available when customers expect them. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Key Qualifications: You may fit well into this role if you have: Strong leadership, relationship management, and communication skills; ability to work effectively with global teams Business acumen and strong stakeholder management skills Technical expertise in SQL, Database logic, etc. Expertise in R, Python, or other statistical language Experience with medium scale predictive reporting initiatives Consumer package goods industry experience preferred Demonstrated business acumen and the ability to balance process and technology to solve business problems Ability to effectively collaborate across technical teams and with business stakeholders Proven ability to be a data strategist and a “hands on” implementer Experience with PowerBI, Business Objects and Azure desired Experience developing Advanced Analytics (Predictive and Prescriptive) Models desired Ability to conceptualize visualization tool capabilities and tell stories with data Ability to conceptualize and deliver What If Analysis, Dynamic Visibility, Hierarchies, Interactive Charts and other features Experience with Data Visualizations and an ability to tell a story through data Ability to operate with minimal direction. As this is a new area for the group, you will need to be the expert. Candidate should have excellent interpersonal and customer facing skills. Ability to travel 25-40% Education/Experience Please consider applying if you have: Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) with a concentration in the field of computer science or related technical discipline 3-5 years of direct experience in business intelligence, reporting and data design, development, support and operations with a leading tool suite If you can imagine yourself in this role, we look forward to hearing from you. Duracell is committed to hiring incredible talent and, as such, offers competitive compensation packages and employee benefits. To this same end, Duracell respects and values the aspects that make each candidate unique and, as an Equal Opportunity employer, is committed to providing a work environment that is free of discrimination against employees and applicants on the basis of any factor prohibited by applicable laws and regulations.

Company Description We are Hawkeye.
